item.title: Neuron Segmentation
item.description: Image: Scan of a part of nervous tissue. Bioscience Image Library, Fayette Reynolds. During my final year of my computer vision degree, I wrote a paper titled “Know Your Neighbour”. In it, I highlighted how techniques in machine learning can be used to improve the efficiency of what’s called “3-dimensional neuron segmentation”, i.e, the process of identififying neurons in 3D space. Both me and my supervisor were very happy with the results, so I decided to write this blog, explaining what it is, how it works and what implications it can have for the future of neuroscience.
